feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 17 at 9:39PM AKST until November 18 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow. Visibility one half mile or less at times in blowing snow. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 10:50AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIALLY IMPACTFUL SNOW EVENT EARLY NEXT WEEK... We continue to monitor the possibility of a significant snow event for portions of Southeast Alaska beginning Sunday afternoon and extending into Tuesday. Cold air moves into the region this weekend with increasing north winds across the panhandle. Early next week there is high confidence

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 17 at 8:05PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor is forecast to oscillate around 3.0 feet overnight and into Saturday before beginning a slow decline. The river level is forecast to remain above flood stage for the foreseeable future.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 17 at 5:17PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ISOLATED FLOODING STILL POSSIBLE ACROSS PUERTO RICO AND THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS DURING THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK...
